name: puncturing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
puncture
[ I or T ] to make a small hole in something, or to get a small hole in something: She had used a screwdriver to puncture two holes in the lid of a paint tin. The knife went through his ribs and punctured his lung.
[ T ] to suddenly make someone less confident or positive: My positive mood was rather punctured by the news.
